inclusion.criterion: documented history of frequent partial onset seizures
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: at least four partial onset seizures per month while taking a constant antiepileptic drug dosage during the screening period
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: a recent history of maintenance on 1 or 2 standard antiepileptic drugs
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: females must be postmenopausal for at least 1 year, or if of childbearing age, be sexually abstinent, surgically sterile, or using adequate birth control measures, and have a negative pregnancy test before study entry.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who do not have epilepsy, such as patients with treatable causes of seizure (for example, cancer or active infection)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: have a documented history (previous 3 months) of generalized status epilepticus while receiving anticonvulsant medication (status epilepticus is a prolonged seizure or seizures repeated frequently over 20 to 30 minutes so that recovery between episodes does not occur)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: have seizures occurring in only clustered patterns (numerous seizures over a short period of time)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: a significant history (within 2 years) of medical disease (heart, kidney, hormone, gynecologic, muscle, bone, gastrointestinal, metabolic, liver diseases or cancer with a metastatic potential)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: history of alcohol or drug abuse history within the past 1 year.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has severe intellectual disability, CHF, and epilepsy. He has a history of seizures since age 13 and was recently tapered off Dilantin. His EEG reports are pending.
